item.title: 59 Edward Rd/Parish Lane Overhanging Vegetation- hedge, 23rd October
item.description:
The overganging vetetation is almost at the footpath edge in places and 2 people passing cannot do so without being hit by the vegatation. Partially sighted people are particularly at risk

item.title: Acorns droped on pavement from tree, 23rd October
item.description:
Residents reporting there is a lot of acorns that have dropped on the pavement it is from a Tree from a resident. It is an old acorn Tree and the with the windy weather there will be more coming down which is a health & safety issue for pedestrians. The acorns come flying down, it has been cleared before. Please could someone look into this matter.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 80, Northall Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattress left outside block, 23rd October
item.description:

item.title: Inadequate Lighting - Kilburn Pl - Part 3, 23rd October
item.description:
Thank you for your response and for clarifying that the street is currently lit to a C3 standard under BS 5489:2020. However, I would like to request a review of this classification. While I understand that C3 lighting is intended for low-footfall or no-throughfare roads, this does not reflect the actual circumstances on Kilburn Pl street. Despite being a no-through road, the area experiences regular pedestrian use by residents and visitors, particularly during the evening. More importantly, there have been repeated incidents of antisocial and illegal activity, as reported to both the police and the council. More than happy to provide reference numbers if required. These ongoing safety concerns indicate that the existing lighting level is insufficient in practice, leaving large dark spots that heighten the sense of insecurity. Under BS 5489:2020, Section 5 (Lighting Design Parameters), local authorities are permitted to adjust the lighting class upward when there is evidence of crime risk or fear of crime. I therefore ask that the council re-evaluate the lighting class for Kilburn Pl — for example, to a C2 classification — and consider additional lanterns or higher-output fittings to provide consistent illumination and improve public safety.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kilburn Place, Kilburn, London
Report on FixMyStreet
